exposure_time.title: [s] Effective exposure time
exposure_time.description: Effective exposure time, corrected for dead time and lost time (seconds).  NOTE: This keyword is present for backward compatibility with ground system software. Where possible, use the FITS Standard keyword XPOSURE for this quantity.
exposure_time.calculation: TFRAME*(NGROUPS*NFRAMES+(NGROUPS-1)*GROUPGAP+DROPFRAMES1)*NINTS) where DROPFRAMES1 is a lookup value from the PRD Datamode table
exposure_time.misc: value is initially calculated, but overridden with CompletedExposure DB value

effective_exposure_time.title: [s] Effective exposure time
effective_exposure_time.description: Effective duration of an exposure, corrected for dead time (i.e., it is the photon counting time); equivalent to keyword EFFEXPTM (seconds).
effective_exposure_time.misc: Value is CompletedExposure.photonCollectingTime, but set from EFFEXPTM. Added by JWSTKD-91 to align with the FITS standard for integration times.

duration.title: [s] Total duration of exposure
duration.description: Total duration of exposure. The integration time multiplied by the number of integrations (seconds).  NOTE: This keyword is present for backward compatibility with ground system software. Where possible, use the FITS Standard keyword TELAPSE for this quantity.
duration.calculation: TOTAL_PHOTON_COLLECTION_TIME+TFRAME*(DROPFRAMES3*NINTS+NRSTSTRT+NRESETS*(NINTS-1)), where TOTAL_PHOTON_COLLECTION_TIME = TFRAME*((NGROUPS*NFRAMES+(NGROUPS-1)*GROUPGAP+DROPFRAMES1)*NINTS) and DROPFRAMES1, DROPFRAMES3 are lookups in the PRD DataModes table

elapsed_exposure_time.title: [s] Total elapsed exposure time
elapsed_exposure_time.description: Total duration of the exposure, including dead times; computed as the difference between exposure end and start times; equivalent to keyword DURATION (seconds).
elapsed_exposure_time.misc: added by JWSTKD-92 to align with the FITS standard for effective integration times

gain_factor.title: Gain scale factor
gain_factor.description: The data scaling factor, expressed as a ratio, between exposures obtained with gain=2 and the nominal gain=1 setting.

clock_adjust_rate.title: [ms/s] Spacecraft Clock Time Adjust RATE
clock_adjust_rate.description: Spacecraft clock time adjustment rate as derived from offset values between the UTC spacecraft time and ground time. A value of zero indicates that a spacecraft clock time adjustment was not in progress during the exposure.

count.title: Running count of exposures in visit
count.description: The EXPCOUNT keyword will be used to count the number of exposures in a visit. The value for the EXPOSURE keyword is intially extracted from the image header in the science telemetry and is reset for each new activity within a visit. Science Data Processing code (SDP) determines a monotonically increasing exposure count within a visit, and capture that number in the EXPCOUNT keyword value. This exposure count will reflect the order in which the exposures were executed.
count.calculation: = int(obsid('ACT_ID')) / count of the exposures in visit

prime_parallel.title: prime or parallel exposure indicator
prime_parallel.description: Identifies the exposure as PRIME, PARALLEL_COORDINATED (same program as the PRIME), or PARALLEL_PURE (different program than the PRIME).
prime_parallel.misc: Derived from observation ID: PRIME if parallel program after 'P' is zeroes, e.g., V87500020001P0000000002101; PARALLEL_COORDINATED if parallel program after 'P' equals prime program after 'V', e.g., V93135324001P9313532302201; PARALLEL_PURE if nonzero parallel program after 'P' is different than prime program after 'V', e.g., V95115001001P9600200102201

start_time.title: [d] exposure start time in MJD
start_time.description: Exposure start time (Modified Julian Date).  NOTE: This keyword is present for backward compatibility with ground system software. Where possible, use the FITS Standard keyword MJD-BEG for this quantity.
start_time.calculation: = input('DATE-OBS') + 'T' + input('TIME-OBS') / UTC exposure start time (MJD)

mid_time.title: [d] exposure mid time in MJD
mid_time.description: Exposure mid time (Modified Julian Date).  NOTE: This keyword is present for backward compatibility with ground system software. Where possible, use the FITS Standard keyword MJD-AVG for this quantity.
mid_time.calculation: Middle of values from EXPSTART and EXPEND

end_time.title: [d] exposure end time in MJD
end_time.description: Time of the last data readout within this exposure (Modified Julian Date).  NOTE: This keyword is present for backward compatibility with ground system software. Where possible, use the FITS Standard keyword MJD-END for this quantity.
end_time.misc: Stop Time of last group in exposure from sci_img_hdr

start_time_mjd.title: [d] exposure start time in MJD
start_time_mjd.description: A timestamp for exposure start, including fraction of day; equivalent to keyword EXPSTART (Modified Julian Date).
start_time_mjd.misc: added by JWSTKD-88 to align with the FITS standard for time coordinates

mid_time_mjd.title: [d] exposure mid-point in MJD
mid_time_mjd.description: A timestamp that corresponds to the mid-point of the exposure, including fraction of day; equivalent to keyword EXPMID. It is used as a reference (for example) for the spacecraft position and time reference system (Modified Julian Date).
mid_time_mjd.misc: added by JWSTKD-89 to align with the FITS standard for time coordinates

end_time_mjd.title: [d] exposure end time in MJD
end_time_mjd.description: A timestamp that corresponds to the end of the exposure, including fraction of day; equivalent to keyword EXPEND (Modified Julian Date).
end_time_mjd.misc: added by JWSTKD-90 to align with the FITS standard for time coordinates

start_time_tdb.title: [d] TDB time of exposure start in MJD
start_time_tdb.description: A timestamp, using the Barycentric Dynamical Time scale (TDB), to denote the time of exposure start (Modified Julian Date).

mid_time_tdb.title: [d] TDB time of exposure mid-point in MJD
mid_time_tdb.description: A timestamp, using the Barycentric Dynamical Time scale (TDB), to denote the time of exposure mid-point (Modified Julian Date).

end_time_tdb.title: [d] TDB time of exposure end in MJD
end_time_tdb.description: A timestamp, using the Barycentric Dynamical Time scale (TDB), to denote the time of exposure end (Modified Julian Date).

start_time_eng.title: UTC exposure start time from engineering data
start_time_eng.description: UTC exposure start time as calcualted from values reported in the engineering data stream (format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss).
start_time_eng.calculation: Calculated from instrument-specific engineering values. For MIRI, (most-significant bytes, least-signifcant bytes) based on DETECTOR: (IMIR_IC_EXP_START_MSB, IMIR_IC_EXP_START_LSB) for MIRIMAGE; (IMIR_LW_EXP_START_MSB, IMIR_LW_EXP_START_LSB) for MIRIFULONG; (IMIR_SW_EXP_START_MSB, IMIR_SW_EXP_START_LSB) for MIRIFUSHORT.

osf_file.title: Observatory Status File name covering this exposure
osf_file.description: Observatory Status File name containing the CompletedExposure row for this exposure.
